intro: Tithymalus villicus, commonly known as the slender tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Native to the temperate regions of Europe and western Asia, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and sunny to partially shaded environments. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
